lottery

Class FileControl

  • java.lang.Object
    • lottery.FileControl

  • public class FileControl
extends java.lang.Object

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      FileControl(java.lang.String fileName)
      Simple File API that opens, creates, writes and reads a file.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean close()
      Safely closes an open file stream of the file in the class.
      boolean create()
      Indiscriminately creates a file based on the filename set.
      boolean open()
      Opens the file set in filename
      java.lang.String readFirstLine()
      Tries to read the very first line of the file in the stream.
      boolean writeFirstLine(java.lang.String line)
      Given a string, writes that string into the first line of the file.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • FileControl

        public FileControl(java.lang.String fileName)
        Simple File API that opens, creates, writes and reads a file. Limited to reading and writing first line of a file only.
        Parameters:
        fileName - The filename of the file to manipulate.

    • Method Detail

      • open

        public boolean open()
        Opens the file set in filename
        Returns:
        True if the file can be opened. False for a very vague error (could be that file does not exist or another)

      • create

        public boolean create()
        Indiscriminately creates a file based on the filename set.
        Returns:
        True if the file was successfully created. False for a very vague error

      • writeFirstLine

        public boolean writeFirstLine(java.lang.String line)
        Given a string, writes that string into the first line of the file.
        Parameters:
        line - The string to write into the first line of the file. Note that this replaces everything in the line.
        Returns:
        True if write was successful. False for a very vague error.

      • readFirstLine

        public java.lang.String readFirstLine()
        Tries to read the very first line of the file in the stream.
        Returns:
        The line in string if it exists. Else, returns blank.

      • close

        public boolean close()
        Safely closes an open file stream of the file in the class. Not in use as the lifetime of the stream is not significantly long. Will probably be used in unit testing.
        Returns:
        True if the stream was closed. Else, false for a very vague error.
